channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: How the Ford Bronco Beats the Jeep Wrangler at Its Own Game
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: The Ford Bronco outperforms the Jeep Wrangler with better tech, comfort, and off-road capability.
item.content:encoded: Few rivalries in the automotive world are as fierce as Ford versus Jeep, and nowhere is that battle more heated than in the off-road segment. For years, the Wrangler has been the benchmark for trail-ready SUVs, but Ford’s modern off-roader is proving it can play by the same rules and still come out ahead.

item.title: This Is What I Fill My Phone's Storage With (It's Not Just Photos)
item.dc:creator: Bertel King
item.description: The base model isn't big enough.
item.content:encoded: I like buying phones with at least 512GB of storage, because I know I will fill up most of that space—and no, it isn't entirely with photos and videos. Here's why having 256GB or less is a non-starter for me.

item.title: These 10 Fox Kids Shows Revived My TV Childhood
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: Fox Kids had the must-watch kids' shows of the 1990s, and these were the best of the block.
item.content:encoded: Between the game-changing block of Disney Afternoon and the mid-'90s renaissance of Kids WB, there was the must-watch block of Fox Kids. The Fox network was already making a name for itself with subversive sitcoms like Married with Children and The Simpsons. While it took them some time to find their footing with their foray into Saturday morning programming, they managed to land on some winning shows in the early to mid-1990s.

item.title: Mini-LED vs. OLED—More Than Just the Battle of Brights and Darks
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: There are all sorts of differences between Mini-LED and OLED that you probably don't think about.
item.content:encoded: When it comes to buying a new TV, eventually, the conversation over OLED and Mini-LED, two of the leading panel technologies today, is going to come up. While both offer a top-tier visual experience, how they actually create the picture and how they handle light and dark are night-and-day different. This gives each its own unique edge when it comes to contrast and brightness.

item.title: 5 Terrible Uses for Micro SD Cards
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Convenient? Yes. Trustworthy? Not on your life!
item.content:encoded: SD and Micro SD cards are wonderful little storage devices, and sometimes I can't believe that I'm holding hundreds of gigabytes in the palm of my hand in something the size of my pinkie nail.

item.title: Frame Generation Is Becoming Mandatory in Some PC Games, and I Don’t Like It
item.dc:creator: Goran Damnjanovic
item.content:encoded: You may have noticed that some PC games now list frame generation as part of their system requirements. The issue here is that system requirements for PC games usually target 60 FPS performance, and playing games at 60 FPS with frame generation feels anything but good.

item.title: Microsoft's Local Accounts Crackdown Is Yet Another Reason to Install Linux
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: Will this be the final straw for you?
item.content:encoded: If you're like me, you've been relying on technical workarounds to set up Windows 11 with a local account instead of the required Microsoft account. Unfortunately, Microsoft is shutting down more of those workarounds, which is just affirming my decision to replace Windows with Linux as my daily driver desktop.

item.title: Why I Still Use a 5-Year-Old Mac Mini in 2025
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.content:encoded: I have no plans to replace the five-year-old Mac mini that’s gracefully aging beneath my TV. I’ll happily buy another when the time comes, but that day still feels like a long way off.

item.title: These Aren't My Favorite Earbuds, but They're the Ones I'd Buy
item.dc:creator: Bertel King
item.description: Unfortunately, the worst part about them is included in the name.
item.content:encoded: At half the price of their more premium counterparts yet almost indistinguishable in both looks and sound, the JLab GO Pods ANC are budget earbuds done right. Plus, at such a small size, the price is hardly the only reason to buy.

item.title: Why Sega’s $70 Million Flop Is the Best Game of All Time
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: How to revolutionize gaming and burn a load of cash at the same time.
item.content:encoded: In late 1999, after spending $70 million developing what was then the most expensive game ever made, SEGA released Shenmue for the Dreamcast. Though the world was a better place for it, the game did not recover its development costs, nor did it get the audience it deserved.
